item.title: Announcing Record-Store, a new (experimental) place for your data
item.description: TL;DR: I’m really happy to announce my latest open-source project called Record-Store ðŸš€ Please check it out on https://pierrez.github.io/record-store. What? Record-Store is a layer running on top of FoundationDB. It provides abstractions to create, load and deletes customer-defined data called records, which are hold into a RecordSpace. We would like to have this kind of flow for developers: Opening KeySpace, for example prod/users Create a protobuf definition which will be used as schema Upsert schema Push records Query records delete records You need another KeySpace to store another type of data, or maybe a KeySpace dedicated to production env?
